intro: Lecanorchis papuana, commonly known as the Papuan twayblade, is an orchid species native to New Guinea. It is a terrestrial herb with a slender, wiry stem and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces delicate, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in a spike, typical of the Orchidaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded forest understories and is often found in areas with rich, humusy soil. Lecanorchis papuana is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
